title: 114_s1798
content: The Act is titled the "United States Commission on International Religious Freedom Reauthorization Act of 2015". Entities of particular concern for religious freedom are designated under this Act. Section 402(b)(1) of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to include designations for governments and non-state actors regarding violations of religious freedom. The International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to designate non-state actors that have engaged in severe violations of religious freedom as entities of particular concern. The International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to designate non-state actors that have engaged in severe violations of religious freedom as entities of particular concern. SEC. 3. ESTABLISHMENT AND COMPOSITION. Section 201 of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to establish an independent Federal Government advisory body. The Commission as a whole should have expertise on various faiths practiced globally, and appointments to the Commission should be made promptly after vacancies occur. The International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to establish an independent Federal Government advisory body called the Commission. The Commission elects a Chair and Vice Chair annually, ensuring political party balance in their appointments. The Commission elects a Chair and Vice Chair annually, ensuring political party balance in their appointments. The positions of Chair and Vice Chair rotate on an annual basis between Commissioners appointed by elected officials of each political party. The Ambassador at Large is given advance notice of all Commission meetings and may attend them. The Ambassador at Large is given advance notice of all Commission meetings and may attend as a non-voting member. Additionally, the second sentence in subsection (g) is removed. The International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to change the powers of the Commission from "may" to "shall". Commission personnel matters are also addressed. Section 204 of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to include annual review of the Executive Director, establish hiring procedures for staff, and encourage the Department of State to involve Commissioners. The Department of State should allow Commissioners and Commission staff access to classified information to fulfill their duties. SEC. 6. STANDARDS OF CONDUCT AND DISCLOSURE. Section 208 of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to address conflicts of interest for Commissioners, prohibiting inappropriate influence from any person, entity, or special interest group. If such influence is discovered, the affected Commissioner must recuse themselves from related discussions or decisions. The amendment to Section 208 of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 addresses conflicts of interest for Commissioners, prohibiting influence from any person, entity, or special interest group. It includes provisions for intern, fellowship, and volunteer programs that must be described in the annual financial report and approved by the Commission. Sponsoring parties can provide compensation and benefits as long as there is no conflict of interest. The amendment to Section 208 of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 prohibits conflicts of interest for Commissioners, allowing sponsoring parties to provide compensation and benefits as long as there is no conflict of interest. SEC. 7 of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to extend the authority until 2021. SEC. 8 focuses on training for foreign service officers. SEC. 8 amends the Foreign Service Act of 1980 to include training for foreign service officers on religious freedom, security, and its role in US foreign policy.
